question: Michael is rolling a 10-sided die. How much more likely is it (expressed as a percentage) that he rolls a number greater than 1 than that he rolls two odd numbers in a row?
answer:
There are 9 numbers greater than 1 on the dice, so the chances of rolling one of them are 9/10=90%.
The chance of rolling one odd number is 50%, so the chance of rolling two in a row is 50% * 50% = 25%.
The difference between these two probabilities is 90% - 25% = 65%.
#### 65
